Hymn.title: ALL YOUR ANXIETY
Hymn.stanza: 1. Is there a heart o'er-bound by sorrow? Is there a life weighed down by care? Come to the cross, each burden bearing, All your anxiety-leave it there.
Hymn.chorus: All your anxiety, all your care, Bring to the mercy seat, leave it there; Never a burden He cannot bear, Never a friend like Jesus.
All your anxiety, all your care, Bring to the mercy seat, leave it there; Never a burden He cannot bear, Never a friend like Jesus.
All your anxiety, all your care, Bring to the mercy seat, leave it there; Never a burden He cannot bear, Never a friend like Jesus.

Hymn.title: COME UNTO ME
Hymn.stanza: 1. Hear the blessed Saviour calling the oppressed, "O ye heavy laden, come to me and rest; Come, no longer tarry, I your load will bear, Bring Me ev'ry burden, bring Me ev'ry care."
2. Are you disappointed, wand'ring here and there, Dragging chains of doubt and loaded down with care? Do unholy feelings struggle in your breast? Bring your case to Jesus, He will give you rest.

3. Stumbling on the mountains dark with sin and shame, Stumbling tow'rd the pit of hell's consuming flames, By the pow'rs of sin deluded and oppressed, Hear the tender Shepherd, "Come to Me and rest."
4. Have you cares of business, cares of pressing debt? Cares of social life or cares of hopes unmet? Are you by remorse or sense of guilt depressed, Come right on to Jesus, He will give you rest.
5. Have you by temptations often conquered been, Has a sense of weakness brought distress within? Christ will sanctify you, if you'll claim His best, In the Holy Spirit, He will give you rest.

Hymn.title: IMPATIENT HEART, BE STILL
Hymn.stanza: 1. Impatient heart, be still! What tho' He tarries long? What tho' the triumph song Is still delay'd? Thou hast His promise sure, And that is all secure; Be not afraid! Be not afraid!
Hymn.chorus: Be still! ... be still! Impatient heart ... be still!
Be still! ... be still! My eager heart ... be still!
Hymn.stanza: 3. My anxious heart, be still! Watch, work, and pray, and then It will not matter when Thy Lord shall come; At midnight, or at noon; He cannot come too soon To take thee home, To take thee home.
Hymn.chorus: Be still! ... be still! My anxious heart ... be still!

Hymn.title: LEAVE IT THERE
Hymn.stanza: 1. If the world from you withhold of its silver and its gold, And you have to get along with meager fare, Just remember, in His Word, how He feeds the little bird; Take your burden to the Lord and leave it there.

2. If your body suffers pain and your health you can't regain, And your soul is almost sinking in despair, Jesus knows the pain you feel, He can save and He can heal; Take your burden to the Lord and leave it there.

Hymn.title: NEVER GIVE UP
Hymn.stanza: 1. Never be sad or desponding If thou hast faith to believe; Grace, for the duties before thee, Ask of thy God and receive.
Hymn.chorus: Nev...er give up,... Nev...er give up,... Never give up to thy sorrows, Jesus will bid them depart; Trust... in the Lord,... Trust... in the Lord,... Sing when your trials are greatest, Trust in the Lord and take heart.

Nev...er give up,... Nev...er give up,... Never give up to thy sorrows, Jesus will bid them depart; Trust... in the Lord,... Trust... in the Lord,... Sing when your trials are greatest, Trust in the Lord and take heart.
Hymn.stanza: 3. Never be sad or desponding, There is a morrow for thee; Soon thou shalt dwell in its brightness, There with the Lord thou shalt be.
Hymn.chorus: Nev...er give up,... Nev...er give up,... Never give up to thy sorrows, Jesus will bid them depart; Trust... in the Lord,... Trust... in the Lord,... Sing when your trials are greatest, Trust in the Lord and take heart.
Hymn.stanza: 4. Never be sad or desponding, Lean on the arm of thy Lord; Dwell in the depths of His mercy, Thou shalt receive thy reward.
Hymn.chorus: Nev...er give up,... Nev...er give up,... Never give up to thy sorrows, Jesus will bid them depart; Trust... in the Lord,... Trust... in the Lord,... Sing when your trials are greatest, Trust in the Lord and take heart.

Hymn.title: YIELD NOT TO TEMPTATION
TURN YOUR EYES UPON JESUS
Hymn.stanza: 1. O soul, are you weary and troubled? No light in the darkness you see? There's light for a look at the Saviour, And life more abundant and free!
Hymn.chorus: Turn your eyes upon Jesus, Look full in His wonderful face, And the things of earth will grow strangely dim In the light of His glory and grace.
Hymn.stanza: 2. Thro' death into life everlasting He passed, and we follow Him there; Over us sin no more hath dominion For more than conq'rors we are!
Hymn.chorus: Turn your eyes upon Jesus, Look full in His wonderful face, And the things of earth will grow strangely dim In the light of His glory and grace.
Hymn.stanza: 3. His Word shall not fail you - He promised; Believe Him, and all will be well: Then go to a world that is dying, His perfect salvation to tell!
Hymn.chorus: Turn your eyes upon Jesus, Look full in His wonderful face, And the things of earth will grow strangely dim In the light of His glory and grace.

Hymn.title: BLESSED BE THE NAME
Hymn.stanza: 1.O for a thousand tongues to sing, Blessed be the name of the Lord! The glories of my God and King! Blessed be the name of the Lord!
Hymn.chorus: Blessed be the name, blessed be the name, Blessed be the name of the Lord! Blessed be the name, blessed be the name, Blessed be the name of the Lord!
Hymn.stanza: 2.Jesus! The name that charms our fears, Blessed be the name of the Lord! 'Tis music in the sinner's ears, Blessed be the name of the Lord!
Hymn.chorus: Blessed be the name, blessed be the name, Blessed be the name of the Lord! Blessed be the name, blessed be the name, Blessed be the name of the Lord!
Hymn.stanza: 3.He breaks the pow'r of cancelled sin, Blessed be the Name of the Lord! His blood can make the foulest clean, Blessed be the Name of the Lord!
Hymn.chorus: Blessed be the name, blessed be the name, Blessed be the name of the Lord! Blessed be the name, blessed be the name, Blessed be the name of the Lord!
Hymn.stanza: 4.I never shall forget that day, Blessed be the name of the Lord! When Jesus washed my sins away, Blessed be the name of the Lord!
Hymn.chorus: Blessed be the name, blessed be the name, Blessed be the name of the Lord! Blessed be the name, blessed be the name, Blessed be the name of the Lord!

Hymn.title: GREAT IS THY FAITHFULNESS
Hymn.stanza: 1. "Great is thy faithfulness," O God my father! There is no shadow of turning with Thee; Thou changest not, Thy compassions, they fail not As Thou hast been Thou for ever wilt be.
Hymn.chorus: "Great is thy faithfulness! Great is thy faithfulness!" Morning by morning new mercies I see, All I have needed Thy hand hath provided - "Great is thy faithfulness, " Lord, unto me!
Hymn.stanza: 2. Summer and winter, and spring time and harvest, Sun, moon and stars in their courses above, Join with all nature in manifold witness, To thy great faithfulness, mercy and love.
Hymn.chorus: "Great is thy faithfulness! Great is thy faithfulness!" Morning by morning new mercies I see, All I have needed Thy hand hath provided - "Great is thy faithfulness, " Lord, unto me!
Hymn.stanza: 3. Pardon for sin and a peace that endureth, Thine own dear presence to cheer and to guide; Strength for today and bright hope for tomorrow, Blessings all mine, with ten thousands beside!
Hymn.chorus: "Great is thy faithfulness! Great is thy faithfulness!" Morning by morning new mercies I see, All I have needed Thy hand hath provided - "Great is thy faithfulness, " Lord, unto me!

Hymn.title: OH, FOR A THOUSAND TONGUES TO SING
Hymn.stanza: 1. O for a thousand tongues to sing My great Redeemer's praise, The glories of my God and King, The triumphs of His grace!
2. My gracious Master and my God, Assist me to proclaim, To spread through all the earth abroad The honours of Thy name.
3. Jesus! The name that charms our fears. That bids our sorrows cease; 'Tis music in the sinner's ears, 'Tis life, and health, and peace.
4. He breaks the power of cancelled sin, He sets the prisoner free; His blood can make the foulest clean, His blood availed for me.
5. Hear Him, ye deaf; His praise, ye dumb, Your loosened tongues employ; Ye blind, behold your Saviour come, And leap, ye lame, for joy!

Hymn.title: HOLY, HOLY, HOLY
Hymn.stanza: 1. Holy, holy, holy! Lord God Almighty! Early in the morning our song shall rise to Thee; Holy, holy, holy, merciful and mighty! God in three Persons, blessed Trinity!
2. Holy, holy, holy! all the saints adore Thee, Casting down their golden crowns around the glassy sea; Cherubim and seraphim falling down before Thee, Who wert, and art, and evermore shalt be.
3. Holy, holy, holy! though the darkness hide Thee, Though the eye of sinful man Thy glory may not see, Only Thou art holy; there is none beside Thee, Perfect in power, in love, and purity.
4. Holy, holy, holy, Lord God Almighty! All Thy works shall praise Thy name, in earth, and sky, and sea! Holy, holy, holy, merciful and mighty! God in three Persons, blessed Trinity!

Hymn.title: PRAISE HIM! PRAISE HIM!
Hymn.stanza: 1. Praise Him! Praise Him! Jesus our blessed Redeemer! Sing, O earth! His wonderful love proclaim; Hail Him! Hail Him! highest archangels in glory, Strength and honour give to His holy name. Like a shepherd, Jesus will guard His children, In His arms He carries them all day long; O ye saints that dwell on the mountain of Zion, Praise Him! praise Him! ever in joyful song.

3. Praise Him! Praise Him! Jesus, our blessed Redeemer, Heav'nly portals, loud with hosannahs ring; Jesus, Saviour, reigneth for ever and ever, Crown Him! Crown Him! Prophet and Priest and King! Death is vanquish'd! Tell it with joy, ye faithful, Where is now thy victory, boasting grave? Jesus lives! no longer thy portals are cheerless, Jesus lives, the mighty and strong to save.

Hymn.title: TO GOD BE THE GLORY
Hymn.stanza: 1.To God be the glory, great things He has done, So loved He the world that He gave us His Son, Who yielded His life an atonement for sin, And opened the Life Gate that all may go in.
Hymn.chorus: Praise the Lord, praise the Lord, Let the earth hear His voice, Praise the Lord, praise the Lord, Let the people rejoice! O come to the Father through Jesus the Son, And give Him the glory, great things He hath done.
Hymn.stanza: 2.O perfect redemption, the purchase of blood, To every believer the promise of God; The vilest offender who truly believes, That moment from Jesus a pardon receives.
Hymn.chorus: Praise the Lord, praise the Lord, Let the earth hear His voice, Praise the Lord, praise the Lord, Let the people rejoice! O come to the Father through Jesus the Son, And give Him the glory, great things He hath done.
Hymn.stanza: 3.Great things He has taught us, great things He has done, And great our rejoicing through Jesus the Son; But purer, and higher, and greater will be Our wonder, our transport when Jesus we see.
Hymn.chorus: Praise the Lord, praise the Lord, Let the earth hear His voice, Praise the Lord, praise the Lord, Let the people rejoice! O come to the Father through Jesus the Son, And give Him the glory, great things He hath done.

Hymn.title: HOW GREAT THOU ART
Hymn.stanza: 1.O Lord my God! When I in awesome wonder, Consider all the works thy hand hath made, I see the stars, I hear the rolling thunder, Thy power thro' out the universe displayed,
4. When Christ shall come with shout of acclamation, And take me home, what joy shall fill my heart! Then I shall bow in humble adoration, And there proclaim, my God, how great thou art!

Hymn.title: O WORSHIP THE KING
Hymn.stanza: 1. O worship the King, All glorious above, O gratefully sing His power and His love; Our Shield and Defender, The Ancient of Days, Pavilion'd in splendour, And girded with praise.
2. O tell of His might, O sing of His grace, Whose robe is the light, Whose canopy space. His chariots of wrath The deep thunder-clouds form, And dark is His path On the wings of the storm.
3. Thy bountiful care, What tongue can recite? It breathes in the air, It shines in the light; It streams from the hills, It descends to the plain, And sweetly distils In the dew and the rain.
4. Frail children of dust, And feeble as frail, In Thee do we trust, Nor find Thee to fail; Thy mercies how tender, How firm to the end, Our Maker, Defender, Redeemer, and Friend!
5. O measureless might! Ineffable love! While angels delight To hymn Thee above, The humbler creation, Though feeble their lays, With true adoration Shall lisp Thy praise.

Hymn.title: (Rejoice in the lord) IF GOD BE FOR US
Hymn.chorus: "If God be for us, if God be for us, If God be for us, who can be against us? Who? Who? Who? Who can be against us, against us?"
Hymn.stanza: 2. Be strong in the Lord! rejoicing in His might, Be loyal and true day by day; When evils assail, be valiant for the right, And He will be our strength and stay.
Hymn.chorus: "If God be for us, if God be for us, If God be for us, who can be against us? Who? Who? Who? Who can be against us, against us?"
Hymn.stanza: 3. Confide in His Word - His promises so sure; In Christ they are "yea and amen;" Though earth pass away, they ever shall endure, 'Tis written o'er and o'er again.
Hymn.chorus: "If God be for us, if God be for us, If God be for us, who can be against us? Who? Who? Who? Who can be against us, against us?
Hymn.stanza: 4. Abide in the Lord: secure in His control, 'Tis life everlasting begun; To pluck from His hand the weakest, trembling soul - It never, never can be done!
Hymn.chorus: "If God be for us, if God be for us, If God be for us, who can be against us? Who? Who? Who? Who can be against us, against us?

Hymn.title: NOTHING BUT THE BLOOD OF JESUS
Hymn.stanza: 1. What can wash away my stain? Nothing but the blood of Jesus, What can make me whole again? Nothing but the blood of Jesus.
Hymn.chorus: Oh, precious is the flow That makes me white as snow; No other fount I know, Nothing but the blood of Jesus.
Hymn.stanza: 2. For my cleansing this I see - Nothing but the blood of Jesus; For my pardon this my plea, - Nothing but the blood of Jesus.
Hymn.chorus: Oh, precious is the flow That makes me white as snow; No other fount I know, Nothing but the blood of Jesus.
Hymn.stanza: 3.Nothing can for sin atone, Nothing but the blood of Jesus: Nought of good that I have done, Nothing but the blood of Jesus.
Hymn.chorus: Oh, precious is the flow That makes me white as snow; No other fount I know, Nothing but the blood of Jesus.
Hymn.stanza: 4. This is all my hope and peace, Nothing but the blood of Jesus; He is all my righteousness - Nothing but the blood of Jesus.
Hymn.chorus: Oh, precious is the flow That makes me white as snow; No other fount I know, Nothing but the blood of Jesus.
Hymn.stanza: 5. Now by this I overcome: Nothing but the blood of Jesus: Now by this I'll reach my home: Nothing but the blood of Jesus!
Hymn.chorus: Oh, precious is the flow That makes me white as snow; No other fount I know, Nothing but the blood of Jesus.

Hymn.title: BLESSED ASSURANCE
Hymn.stanza: 1. Blessed assurance, Jesus is mine! Oh, what a fore-taste of glory divine! Heir of salvation, purchase of God, Born of His Spirit, wash'd in His blood.
Hymn.chorus: This is my story, this is my song, Praising my Saviour all the day long; This is my story, this is my song, Praising my Saviour all the day long.
Hymn.stanza: 2. Perfect submission, perfect delight, Visions of rapture now burst on my sight, Angels descending, bring from above Echoes of mercy, whispers of love.
Hymn.chorus: This is my story, this is my song, Praising my Saviour all the day long; This is my story, this is my song, Praising my Saviour all the day long.
Hymn.stanza: 3. Perfect submission, all is at rest, I in my Saviour am happy and blest; Watching and waiting, looking above, Fill'd with His goodness, lost in His love.
Hymn.chorus: This is my story, this is my song, Praising my Saviour all the day long; This is my story, this is my song, Praising my Saviour all the day long.

Hymn.title: CHRIST JESUS HATH THE POWER
Hymn.stanza: 1. Christ Jesus hath the pow'r, The power to forgive, The pow'r to quicken whom He will, And make the sinner live. Christ Jesus hath the pow'r, O tell it far and near! O bring to Him your guilty heart, And grace shall banish fear!
Hymn.chorus: Christ Jesus hath the pow'r, The pow'r of God He wields! Christ Jesus hath the pow'r, My heart surrender yields! Christ Jesus hath the pow'r, I trust Him evermore! Christ Jesus hath the pow'r, I worship and adore!
Hymn.stanza: 2. Christ Jesus hath the pow'r, The power to renew, The pow'r to cleanse your heart from sin, And make you wholly true. Christ Jesus hath the pow'r For evermore to keep; O none can pluck you from His hand, Or rob Him of His sheep!
Hymn.chorus: Christ Jesus hath the pow'r, The pow'r of God He wields! Christ Jesus hath the pow'r, My heart surrender yields! Christ Jesus hath the pow'r, I trust Him evermore! Christ Jesus hath the pow'r, I worship and adore!
Hymn.stanza: 3. Christ Jesus hath the pow'r, The power to console, The pow'r to carry all your care - On Him your burdens roll. Christ Jesus hath the pow'r, To wipe the tear away; O place in Him your confidence! O trust Him, and obey!
Hymn.chorus: Christ Jesus hath the pow'r, The pow'r of God He wields! Christ Jesus hath the pow'r, My heart surrender yields! Christ Jesus hath the pow'r, I trust Him evermore! Christ Jesus hath the pow'r, I worship and adore!
Hymn.stanza: 4. Christ Jesus hath the pow'r, The power to destroy, The pow'r to bruise your enemy Who would your soul annoy. Christ Jesus hath the pow'r, When on your dying bed, To give your soul the victory, The pow'r to raise the dead!
Hymn.chorus: Christ Jesus hath the pow'r, The pow'r of God He wields! Christ Jesus hath the pow'r, My heart surrender yields! Christ Jesus hath the pow'r, I trust Him evermore! Christ Jesus hath the pow'r, I worship and adore!

Hymn.title: THE WAY, THE TRUTH, THE LIFE
Hymn.stanza: 1. "I am the Way".the Saviour said, And I would follow on, Content to know that after night Shall break a glorious dawn.
Hymn.chorus: "I am the Way, the Truth and the life, No man cometh unto the Father but by me", "I am the Way, the Truth and the Life, No man cometh unto the Father but by me".
Hymn.stanza: 2."I am the Truth," then Truth shall be, A beacon light to guide. My bark across the Stormy Sea To where still waters glide.
Hymn.chorus: "I am the Way, the Truth and the life, No man cometh unto the Father but by me", "I am the Way, the Truth and the Life, No man cometh unto the Father but by me".
Hymn.stanza: 3. "I am the Life," there is no death, For me to fear, nor dread, Since by His all atoning blood, My life to His is wed.
Hymn.chorus: "I am the Way, the Truth and the life, No man cometh unto the Father but by me", "I am the Way, the Truth and the Life, No man cometh unto the Father but by me".

Hymn.title: WILL YOUR ANCHOR HOLD
Hymn.stanza: 1.Will your anchor hold in the storms of life? When the clouds unfold their wings of strife; When the strong tides lift, and the cables strain, Will your anchor drift or firm remain?
Hymn.chorus: We have an anchor that keeps the soul Steadfast and sure while the billows roll, Fastened to the Rock which cannot move, Grounded firm and deep in the Saviour's love.
Hymn.stanza: 2.It is safely moored 'twill the storm withstand, For 'tis well secured by the Saviour's hand; And the cables passed from His heart to mine, Can defy the blast, through strength divine.
Hymn.chorus: We have an anchor that keeps the soul Steadfast and sure while the billows roll, Fastened to the Rock which cannot move, Grounded firm and deep in the Saviour's love.
Hymn.stanza: 3.It will firmly hold in the straits of fear, When the breakers have told the reef is near; Though the tempest rave and the wild winds blow, Not an angry wave shall our bark o'er flow.
Hymn.chorus: We have an anchor that keeps the soul Steadfast and sure while the billows roll, Fastened to the Rock which cannot move, Grounded firm and deep in the Saviour's love.
Hymn.stanza: 4.It will surely hold in the floods of death, When the waters cold chill our latest breath, On the rising tide it can never fail, While our hopes abide within the veil!
Hymn.chorus: We have an anchor that keeps the soul Steadfast and sure while the billows roll, Fastened to the Rock which cannot move, Grounded firm and deep in the Saviour's love.
Hymn.stanza: 5. When our eyes behold, through the gathering night The city of gold, our harbour bright, We shall anchor fast by the heavenly shore, With the storms all past for evermore.
Hymn.chorus: We have an anchor that keeps the soul Steadfast and sure while the billows roll, Fastened to the Rock which cannot move, Grounded firm and deep in the Saviour's love.

Hymn.title: SIMPLY TRUSTING EVERYDAY
Hymn.stanza: 1. Simply trusting every day, Trusting through a stormy way, Even when my faith is small, Trusting Jesus, that is all.
Hymn.chorus: Trusting as the moments fly, Trusting as the days go by, Trusting him whate'er befall, Trusting Jesus, that is all.
Hymn.stanza: 2. Brightly doth his Spirit shine Into this poor heart of mine; While He leads I cannot fall, Trusting Jesus, that is all.
Hymn.chorus: Trusting as the moments fly, Trusting as the days go by, Trusting him whate'er befall, Trusting Jesus, that is all.
Hymn.stanza: 3. Singing, if my way be clear, Praying, if the path be drear, If in danger for him call, Trusting Jesus, that is all.
Hymn.chorus: Trusting as the moments fly, Trusting as the days go by, Trusting him whate'er befall, Trusting Jesus, that is all.
Hymn.stanza: 4. Trusting Him while life shall last, Trusting him till earth be past; Till within the jasper wall, Trusting Jesus, that is all.
Hymn.chorus: Trusting as the moments fly, Trusting as the days go by, Trusting him whate'er befall, Trusting Jesus, that is all.

Hymn.title: NO OTHER PLEA
Hymn.chorus: I need no other argument, I need no other plea; It is enough that Jesus died, And that He died for me.
Hymn.stanza: 2. Enough for me that Jesus saves, This ends my fear and doubt; A sinful soul I come to Him, He'll never cast me out.
Hymn.chorus: I need no other argument, I need no other plea; It is enough that Jesus died, And that He died for me.
Hymn.stanza: 3. My heart is leaning on the Word, The written Word of God, Salvation by my Saviour's name, Salvation through His blood.
Hymn.chorus: I need no other argument, I need no other plea; It is enough that Jesus died, And that He died for me.
Hymn.stanza: 4. My great Physician heals the sick, The lost He came to save; For me His precious blood He shed, For me His life He gave.
Hymn.chorus: I need no other argument, I need no other plea; It is enough that Jesus died, And that He died for me.

Hymn.title: IT IS WELL WITH MY SOUL
Hymn.stanza: 1. When peace, like a river, attendeth my way, When sorrows like sea billows roll; Whatever my lot, Thou has taught me to know, "It is well, it is well, with my soul."
Hymn.chorus: It is well,... with my soul..... It is well, it is well with my soul.
Hymn.stanza: 2. Tho' Satan should buffet, if trials should come, Let this blest assurance control, That Christ has regarded my helpless estate, And hath shed His own blood for my soul.
Hymn.chorus: It is well,... with my soul..... It is well, it is well with my soul.
Hymn.stanza: 3. My sin - oh, the bliss of this glorious thought- My sin - not in part, but the whole, Is nailed to His cross: and I bear it no more: Praise the Lord, praise the Lord, O my soul.
Hymn.chorus: It is well,... with my soul..... It is well, it is well with my soul.
Hymn.stanza: 4. For me, be it Christ, be it Christ hence to live! If Jordan above me shall roll, No pang shall be mine, for in death as in life Thou wilt whisper Thy peace to my soul.
Hymn.chorus: It is well,... with my soul..... It is well, it is well with my soul.
Hymn.stanza: 5. But, Lord, 'tis for Thee, for Thy coming we wait, The sky, not the grave, is our goal; Oh trump of the angel! Oh voice of the Lord! Blessed hope! blessed rest of my soul!
Hymn.chorus: It is well,... with my soul..... It is well, it is well, with my soul.

Hymn.title: NOW I BELONG TO JESUS
Hymn.stanza: 1. Jesus, my Lord, will love me for ever, From Him no pow'r of evil can sever, He gave His life to ransom my soul; Now I belong to Him:
Hymn.chorus: Now I belong to Jesus, Jesus belongs to me, Not for the years of time alone, But for eternity.
Hymn.stanza: 2. Once I was lost in sin's degradation, Jesus came down to bring me salvation, Lifted me up from sorrow and shame, Now I belong to Him;
Hymn.chorus: Now I belong to Jesus, Jesus belongs to me, Not for the years of time alone, But for eternity.
Hymn.stanza: 3.Joy floods my soul for Jesus has saved me, Freed me from sin that long had enslaved me His precious blood, He gave to redeem, Now I belong to Him;
Hymn.chorus: Now I belong to Jesus, Jesus belongs to me, Not for the years of time alone, But for eternity.

Hymn.title: I KNOW WHOM I HAVE BELIEVED
Hymn.stanza: 1. I know not why God's wondrous grace To me He hath made known, Nor why, unworthy, Christ in love Redeem'd me for His own.
Hymn.chorus: But I know Whom I have believed, And am persuaded that He is able To keep that which I've committed Unto Him against that day.
Hymn.stanza: 2. I know not how this saving faith To me He did impart, Nor how believing in His Word Wrought peace within my heart.
Hymn.chorus: But I know Whom I have believed, And am persuaded that He is able To keep that which I've committed Unto Him against that day.
Hymn.stanza: 3.I know not how the Spirit moves, Convincing men of sin, Revealing Jesus thro' the Word, Creating faith in Him.
Hymn.chorus: But I know Whom I have believed, And am persuaded that He is able To keep that which I've committed Unto Him against that day.
Hymn.stanza: 4. I know not what of good or ill May be reserved for me, Of weary ways or golden days, Before His face I see.
Hymn.chorus: But I know Whom I have believed, And am persuaded that He is able To keep that which I've committed Unto Him against that day.
Hymn.stanza: 5. I know not when my Lord may come, At night or noonday fair, Nor if I'll walk the vale with Him, Or "meet Him in the air."
Hymn.chorus: But I know Whom I have believed, And am persuaded that He is able To keep that which I've committed Unto Him against that day.

Hymn.title: I AM BOUND FOR CANNAN
Hymn.stanza: 1. Storms do not alarm me, They sometime must cease, Trials cannot harm me, For I have blessed peace; All I've left behind me, I long for no more, Better things shall find me On Canaan's shore.
Hymn.chorus: Let those who will stay in Egypt land, I am bound for Canaan, Where milk and honey flowing, Shall every need supply; All battles fought and the victory won, Peace and joy my portion, My soul shall rest on its shore by and by.
Hymn.stanza: 2. Troubles do not fret me, They cannot abide, Though they may beset me, In Jesus, I will hide, All the world's commotion About me may roar, There's no stormy ocean On Canaan's shore.
Hymn.chorus: Let those who will stay in Egypt land, I am bound for Canaan, Where milk and honey flowing, Shall every need supply; All battles fought and the victory won, Peace and joy my portion, My soul shall rest on its shore by and by.
Hymn.stanza: 3. I in grace abiding, Am trying to stay, In the shadow hiding Of Canaan's perfect day; All I trust may fail me, 'Twill matter no more, Nothing can assail me On Canaan's shore.
Hymn.chorus: Let those who will stay in Egypt land, I am bound for Canaan, Where milk and honey flowing, Shall every need supply; All battles fought and the victory won, Peace and joy my portion, My soul shall rest on its shore by and by.

Hymn.title: I'M LIVING IN CANANN
Hymn.stanza: 1. All that drew me I have left behind Here in Canaan better joys I find; Peace abiding, blessings unconfined, For I'm living in Canaan now.
Hymn.chorus: I am living in Canaan now, Where the showers of blessing abound, Where the riches of grace in plenty are found, I am living in Canaan now
Hymn.stanza: 2.Safe abiding I will never fear, For my Saviour ever will be near; When I call Him He will always hear, For I'm living in Canaan now.
Hymn.chorus: I am living in Canaan now, Where the showers of blessing abound, Where the riches of grace in plenty are found, I am living in Canaan now
Hymn.stanza: 3.I am drinking from a ceaseless well; Here in Canaan where I love to dwell, So to others I am glad to tell, That I'm living in Canaan now.
Hymn.chorus: I am living in Canaan now, Where the showers of blessing abound, Where the riches of grace in plenty are found, I am living in Canaan now
Hymn.stanza: 4. Praises ever I am glad to bring Unto Jesus, my Redeemer King, For His mercies I will shout and sing, For I'm living in Canaan now.
Hymn.chorus: I am living in Canaan now, Where the showers of blessing abound, Where the riches of grace in plenty are found, I am living in Canaan now

Hymn.title: I KNOW WHO HOLDS TOMORROW
Hymn.stanza: 1. I don't know about tomorrow, I just live from day to day; I don't borrow from its sunshine For its skies may turn to gray; I don't worry o'er the future, For I know what Jesus said, And today I'll walk beside Him For He knows what is ahead.
Hymn.chorus: Many things about tomorrow I don't seem to understand But I know who holds tomorrow And I know who holds my hand
Hymn.stanza: 2. Ev'ry step is getting brighter As the golden stairs I climb; Ev'ry burden's getting lighter, Ev'ry cloud is silver-lined. There the sun is always shining, There no tear will dim the eye; At the ending of the rainbow Where the mountains touch the sky.
Hymn.chorus: Many things about tomorrow I don't seem to understand But I know who holds tomorrow And I know who holds my hand
Hymn.stanza: 3. I don't know about tomorrow, It may bring me poverty; But the one who feeds the sparrow Is the one who stands by me; And the path that be my portion, May be through the flame or flood, But His presence goes before me, And I'm covered with His blood.
Hymn.chorus: Many things about tomorrow I don't seem to understand But I know who holds tomorrow And I know who holds my hand

Hymn.title: I'VE ANCHORED IN JESUS
Hymn.stanza: 1. Upon life's boundless ocean where mighty billows roll, I've fixed my hope in Jesus, blest anchor of my soul; When trials fierce assail me as storms are gathering o'er, I rest upon His mercy and trust Him more.
Hymn.chorus: I've anchored in Jesus, the storms of life I'll brave, I've anchored in Jesus, I fear no wind or wave; I've anchored in Jesus, for He hath pow'r to save, I've anchored to the Rock of Ages.
Hymn.stanza: 2. He keeps my soul from evil and gives me blessed peace, His voice hath stilled the waters and bid their tumult cease; My Pilot and Deliverer, to Him I all confide, For always when I need Him, He's at my side.
Hymn.chorus: I've anchored in Jesus, the storms of life I'll brave, I've anchored in Jesus, I fear no wind or wave; I've anchored in Jesus, for He hath pow'r to save, I've anchored to the Rock of Ages.
Hymn.stanza: 3. He is my Friend and Saviour, in Him my anchor's cast, He drives away my sorrows and shields me from the blast; By faith I'm looking upward beyond life's troubled sea, There I behold a haven prepared for me.
Hymn.chorus: I've anchored in Jesus, the storms of life I'll brave, I've anchored in Jesus, I fear no wind or wave; I've anchored in Jesus, for He hath pow'r to save, I've anchored to the Rock of Ages.

Hymn.title: HE TOUCHED ME
Hymn.stanza: 1. Shackled by a heavy burden, 'Neath a load of guilt and shame; Then the hand of Jesus touched me, And now I am no longer the same.
Hymn.chorus: He touched me, Oh, He touched me, And Oh, the joy that floods my soul. Something happened, and now I know, He touched me and made me whole.
Hymn.stanza: 2. Since I met this blessed Saviour, Since He cleansed and made me whole; I will never cease to praise Him, I'll shout it while eternity rolls.
Hymn.chorus: He touched me, Oh, He touched me, And Oh, the joy that floods my soul. Something happened, and now I know, He touched me and made me whole.

Hymn.title: HEAVEN CAME DOWN
Hymn.stanza: 1. O what a wonderful, wonderful day, Day I will never forget; After I'd wandered in darkness away, Jesus my Saviour I met. O what a tender, compassionate friend! He met the need of my heart; Shadows dispelling, with joy I am telling, He made all the darkness depart.
Hymn.chorus: Heaven came down and glory filled my soul, When at the cross the Saviour made me whole, My sins were washed away and my night was turned to day! Heaven came down and glory filled my soul!
Hymn.stanza: 2. Born of the Spirit with life from above Into God's fam'ly divine, Justified fully through Calvary's love, O what a standing is mine! And the transaction so quickly was made, When as a sinner I came, Took of the offer, of grace He did proffer - He saved me, O praise His dear name!
Hymn.chorus: Heaven came down and glory filled my soul, When at the cross the Saviour made me whole, My sins were washed away and my night was turned to day! Heaven came down and glory filled my soul!
Hymn.stanza: 3. Now I've a hope that will surely endure After the passing of time; I have a future in heaven for sure, There in those mansions sublime. And it's because of that wonderful day, When at the cross I believed; Riches eternal and blessings supernal, From His precious hand I received.
Hymn.chorus: Heaven came down and glory filled my soul, When at the cross the Saviour made me whole, My sins were washed away and my night was turned to day! Heaven came down and glory filled my soul!

Hymn.title: SINCE JESUS CAME INTO MY HEART
Hymn.stanza: 1. What a wonderful change in my life has been wrought Since Jesus came into my heart; I have light in my soul for which long I had sought, Since Jesus came into my heart.
Hymn.chorus: Since Jesus came into my heart, Since Jesus came into my heart, Floods of joy o'er my soul Like the sea billows roll, Since Jesus came into my heart.
Hymn.stanza: 2. I have ceased from my wand'ring and going astray, Since Jesus came into my heart; And my sins, which were many are all washed away, Since Jesus came into my heart.
Hymn.chorus: Since Jesus came into my heart, Since Jesus came into my heart, Floods of joy o'er my soul Like the sea billows roll, Since Jesus came into my heart.
Hymn.stanza: 3. I shall go there to dwell in that City, I know, Since Jesus came into my heart; And I'm happy, so happy as onward I go, Since Jesus came into my heart.
Hymn.chorus: Since Jesus came into my heart, Since Jesus came into my heart, Floods of joy o'er my soul Like the sea billows roll, Since Jesus came into my heart.

Hymn.title: CONSTANTLY ABIDING
Hymn.stanza: 1. There's a peace in my heart that the world never gave, A peace it cannot take away; Though the trials of life may surround like a cloud, I've a peace that has come here to stay!
Hymn.chorus: Con....stantly abid...ing, Je...sus is mine;... Con....stantly abid...ing, rapture divine; He never leaves me lonely, whispers, O so kind- "I will never leave thee," Jesus is mine.
Hymn.stanza: 2. All the world seemed to sing of a Saviour and King, When peace sweetly came to my heart; Troubles all fled away and my night turned to day, Blessed Jesus, how glorious Thou art!
Hymn.chorus: Con....stantly abid...ing, Je...sus is mine;... Con....stantly abid...ing, rapture divine; He never leaves me lonely, whispers, O so kind- "I will never leave thee," Jesus is mine.
Hymn.stanza: 3. This treasure I have in a temple of clay, While here on His footstool I roam; But He's coming to take me some glorious day, Over there to my heavenly home!
Hymn.chorus: Con....stantly abid...ing, Je...sus is mine;... Con....stantly abid...ing, rapture divine; He never leaves me lonely, whispers, O so kind- "I will never leave thee," Jesus is mine.

Hymn.title: A NEW NAME IN GLORY
Hymn.stanza: 1. I was once a sinner, but I came Pardon to receive from my Lord: This was freely given, and I found That He always kept His word.
Hymn.chorus: There's a new name written down in glory, And it's mine, O yes, it's mine! And the white robed angels sing the story, "A sinner has come home." For there's a new name written down in glory, And it's mine, O yes, it's mine! With my sins forgiven I am bound for Heaven, Never more to roam.
Hymn.stanza: 2. I was humbly kneeling at the cross, Fearing naught but God's angry frown; When the heavens opened and I saw That my name was written down.
Hymn.chorus: There's a new name written down in glory, And it's mine, O yes, it's mine! And the white robed angels sing the story, "A sinner has come home." For there's a new name written down in glory, And it's mine, O yes, it's mine! With my sins forgiven I am bound for Heaven, Never more to roam.
Hymn.stanza: 3. In the Book 'tis written, "Saved by Grace," O the joy that came to my soul! Now I am forgiven, and I know By the blood I am made whole.
Hymn.chorus: There's a new name written down in glory, And it's mine, O yes, it's mine! And the white robed angels sing the story, "A sinner has come home." For there's a new name written down in glory, And it's mine, O yes, it's mine! With my sins forgiven I am bound for Heaven, Never more to roam.

Hymn.title: MY NAME'S WRITTEN THERE
Hymn.stanza: 1. I am bought not with riches, Neither silver nor gold; But Christ hath redeemed me, I am safe in His fold; In the Book of His kingdom, With its pages so fair, Through Jesus my Saviour, My name's written there.
Hymn.chorus: My name's written there, On the page white and fair; In the Book of God's kingdom, My name's written there.
Hymn.stanza: 2. My sins, they were many, Like the sands of the sea, But the blood of my Saviour Is sufficient for me; For His promise is written, In bright letters that glow, "Tho' your sins be as scarlet, I will make them like snow".
Hymn.chorus: My name's written there, On the page white and fair; In the Book of God's kingdom, My name's written there.
Hymn.stanza: 3. Oh! that beautiful city, With its mansions of light, With its glorified beings, In pure garments of white; Where no evil thing cometh To despoil what is fair; Where the angels are watching, My name's written there.
Hymn.chorus: My name's written there, On the page white and fair; In the Book of God's kingdom, My name's written there.

Hymn.title: WHEN I SEE THE BLOOD
Hymn.stanza: 1. Christ our Redeemer died on the cross, Died for the sinner, paid all his due. All who receive Him need never fear, Yes, He will pass, will pass over you.
Hymn.chorus: When I see the blood, When I see the blood, When I see the blood, I will pass, I will pass over you.
When I see the blood, When I see the blood, When I see the blood, I will pass, I will pass over you.
Hymn.stanza: 3. Judgement is coming, all will be there. Who have rejected, who have refused; Oh, sinner, hasten, let Jesus in, Then God will pass, will pass over you.
Hymn.chorus: When I see the blood, When I see the blood, When I see the blood, I will pass, I will pass over you.
Hymn.stanza: 4. Oh, what compassion, oh, boundless love! Jesus hath power, Jesus is true; All who believe are safe from the storm, Oh, He will pass, will pass over you.
Hymn.chorus: When I see the blood, When I see the blood, When I see the blood, I will pass, I will pass over you.

Hymn.title: HAVE YOU BEEN TO JESUS
Hymn.stanza: 1. Have you been to Jesus for the cleansing power? Are you washed in the blood of the Lamb? Are you fully trusting in His grace this hour? Are you wash'd in the blood of the Lamb?
Hymn.chorus: Are you washed.... in the blood, In the soul cleansing blood of the Lamb? Are your garments spotless? Are they white as snow? Are you washed in the blood of the Lamb?
Hymn.stanza: 2. Are you walking daily by the Saviour's side? Are you washed in the blood of the Lamb? Do you rest each moment in the Crucified? Are you washed in the blood of the Lamb?
Hymn.chorus: Are you washed.... in the blood, In the soul cleansing blood of the Lamb? Are your garments spotless? Are they white as snow? Are you washed in the blood of the Lamb?
Hymn.stanza: 3. When the Bridegroom cometh will your robes be white? Pure and white in the blood of the Lamb? Will your soul be ready for the mansions bright, And be washed in the blood of the Lamb?
Hymn.chorus: Are you washed.... in the blood, In the soul cleansing blood of the Lamb? Are your garments spotless? Are they white as snow? Are you washed in the blood of the Lamb?
Hymn.stanza: 4. Lay aside the garments that are stained with sin, And be washed in the blood of the Lamb; There's a fountain flowing for the soul unclean, Oh be washed in the blood of the Lamb!
Hymn.chorus: Are you washed.... in the blood, In the soul cleansing blood of the Lamb? Are your garments spotless? Are they white as snow? Are you washed in the blood of the Lamb?

Hymn.title: POWER IN THE BLOOD
Hymn.stanza: 1. Would you be free from the burden of sin? There's pow'r in the blood, pow'r in the blood; Would you o'er evil a victory win? There's wonderful pow'r in the blood.
Hymn.chorus: There is pow'r, pow'r, wonder-working pow'r In the blood of the Lamb; There is pow'r, pow'r, wonder-working pow'r In the precious blood of the Lamb.
There is pow'r, pow'r, wonder-working pow'r In the blood of the Lamb; There is pow'r, pow'r, wonder-working pow'r In the precious blood of the Lamb.
There is pow'r, pow'r, wonder-working pow'r In the blood of the Lamb; There is pow'r, pow'r, wonder-working pow'r In the precious blood of the Lamb.
Hymn.stanza: 4. Would you do service for Jesus your King? There's pow'r in the blood, pow'r in the blood; Would you live daily His praises to sing? There's wonderful pow'r in the blood.
Hymn.chorus: There is pow'r, pow'r, wonder-working pow'r In the blood of the Lamb; There is pow'r, pow'r, wonder-working pow'r In the precious blood of the Lamb.

Hymn.title: WASH ME, O LAMB OF GOD
Hymn.stanza: 1. Wash me, O Lamb of God, wash me from sin! By Thine atoning blood, oh, make me clean! Purge me from every stain, let me Thine image gain, In love and mercy reign O'er all within.
2. Wash me, O Lamb of God, wash me from sin! I long to be like Thee - all pure within. Now let the crimson tide, shed from Thy wounded side, Be to my heart applied, and make me clean.
3. Wash me, O Lamb of God, wash me from sin! I will not, cannot, rest till pure within. All human skill is vain, but Thou canst cleanse each stain Till not a spot remain, made wholly clean.
4. Wash me, O Lamb of God, wash me from sin! By faith Thy cleansing blood Now makes me clean. So near art Thou to me, So sweet my rest in Thee, Oh, blessed purity, saved, saved from sin!
5. Wash me, O Lamb of God, wash me from sin! Thou, while I trust in Thee, Wilt keep me clean. Each day to Thee I bring Heart, life - yea, everything; Saved while to Thee I cling, Saved from all sin!

Hymn.title: ONWARD, CHRISTIAN SOLDIERS!
Hymn.stanza: 1.Onward, Christian soldiers! Marching as to war, Looking unto Jesus Who is gone before; Christ, the royal Master, Leads against the foe; Forward into battle, See His banners go!
Hymn.chorus: Onward, Christian soldiers, Marching as to war, Looking unto Jesus, Who is gone before.
Hymn.stanza: 2. At the name of Jesus Satan's host doth flee; On then, Christian soldiers, On to victory! Hell's foundations quiver At the shout of praise: Brothers, lift your voices, Loud your anthems raise.
Hymn.chorus: Onward, Christian soldiers, Marching as to war, Looking unto Jesus, Who is gone before.
Hymn.stanza: 3.Like a mighty army Moves the church of God; Brothers, we are treading where the saints have trod. We are not divided, All one body we - One in hope and doctrine, One in charity.
Hymn.chorus: Onward, Christian soldiers, Marching as to war, Looking unto Jesus, Who is gone before.
Hymn.stanza: 4. Crowns and thrones may perish, kingdoms rise and wane; But the church of Jesus Constant will remain: Gates of hell can never 'Gainst that church prevail; We have Christ's own promise - And that cannot fail.
Hymn.chorus: Onward, Christian soldiers, Marching as to war, Looking unto Jesus, Who is gone before.
Hymn.stanza: 5. Onward then, ye people, Join our happy throng; Blend with ours your voices In the triumph song: "Glory, praise, and honour Unto Christ the King," - This through countless ages Men and angels sing.
Hymn.chorus: Onward, Christian soldiers, Marching as to war, Looking unto Jesus, Who is gone before.

Hymn.title: CLOSE TO THEE
Hymn.stanza: 1. Thou my everlasting Portion, More than friend or life to me, All along my pilgrim journey, Saviour, let me walk with Thee.
Hymn.chorus: Close to Thee, close to thee close to thee, close to thee, All along my pilgrim journey, Saviour, let me walk with Thee.
Hymn.stanza: 2. Not for ease or worldly pleasure, Nor for fame my prayer shall be; Gladly will I toil and suffer, Only let me walk with Thee.
Hymn.chorus: Close to Thee, close to thee close to thee, close to thee, Gladly will I toil and suffer, Only let me walk with Thee.
Hymn.stanza: 3. Lead me through the vale of shadows, Bear me o'er life's fitful sea; Then the gate of life eternal May I enter, Lord, with Thee.
Hymn.chorus: Close to Thee, close to thee' close to thee, close to thee, Then the gate of life eternal May I enter, Lord, with Thee.

Hymn.title: TRUST AND OBEY
Hymn.stanza: 1. When we walk with the Lord in the light of His Word, What a glory He sheds on our way! While we do His good will, He abides with us still, And with all who will trust and obey.
Hymn.chorus: Trust and obey! For there's no other way To be happy in Jesus, But to trust and obey.
Hymn.stanza: 2. Not a shadow can rise, not a cloud in the skies, But His smile quickly drives it away; Not a doubt or a fear, not a sigh or a tear, Can abide while we trust and obey.
Hymn.chorus: Trust and obey! For there's no other way To be happy in Jesus, But to trust and obey.
Hymn.stanza: 3. Not a burden we bear, not a sorrow we share, But our toil He doth richly repay; Not a grief or a loss, not a frown or a cross, But is blest if we trust and obey.
Hymn.chorus: Trust and obey! For there's no other way To be happy in Jesus, But to trust and obey.
Hymn.stanza: 4. But we never can prove the delights of His love Until all on the altar we lay; For the favour He shows, for the joy He bestows, Are for them who will trust and obey.
Hymn.chorus: Trust and obey! For there's no other way To be happy in Jesus, But to trust and obey.
Hymn.stanza: 5. Then in fellowship sweet we will sit at His feet. Or we'll walk by His side in the way. What He says we will do, where He sends we will go; Never fear, only trust and obey.
Hymn.chorus: Trust and obey! For there's no other way To be happy in Jesus, But to trust and obey.

Hymn.title: COME OVER
Hymn.stanza: 1. There's a land of peace and plenty, and its gates are open wide; And the pure in heart and holy in its shelter may abide, It is not thro' gates of glory that a soul must enter in; But all who would find entrance there must leave the ways of sin.
Hymn.chorus: Come over, come over, to the land of corn and wine, There is nothing can compare with the many holy pleasures there, Come over, come over, leave the desert plain below and come away, Away, come o. . . ver.
Hymn.stanza: 2. There is bread of heaven in growing, in its fair and fertile fields, And the wine of love its vineyard to the thirsting mortal yields; There are mountain heights of glory that await the trav'lers rod, And blest retreats where empty souls draw nearer unto God.
Hymn.chorus: Come over, come over, to the land of corn and wine, There is nothing can compare with the many holy pleasures there, Come over, come over, leave the desert plain below and come away, Away, come o. . . ver.
Hymn.stanza: 3. Who would stay without its borders, in the desert dark and drear, When the luscious grapes of eschol, are so very, very, near? Enter in then with rejoicing, for the Lord is on your side, And in His glorious presence, ever more you shall abide.
Hymn.chorus: Come over, come over, to the land of corn and wine, There is nothing can compare with the many holy pleasures there, Come over, come over, leave the desert plain below and come away, Away, come o. . . ver.

Hymn.title: JESUS, MY STRENGTH, MY HOPE
Hymn.stanza: 1.Jesus, my Strength, my Hope, On Thee I cast my care, With humble confidence look up, And know Thou hear'st my prayer. Give me on Thee to wait, Till I can all things do; On Thee, Almighty to create, Almighty to renew.

2. I want a godly fear, A quick discerning eye That looks to Thee when sin is near And sees the tempter fly: A spirit still prepared And armed with jealous care, For ever standing on its guard And watching unto prayer.

3. I want a true regard, A single, steady aim, Unmoved by threatening or reward, To Thee and Thy great name; A jealous, just concern For Thine immortal praise; A pure desire that all may learn And glorify Thy grace.

4. I rest upon Thy Word; The promise is for me; My succour and salvation, Lord, shall surely come from Thee: But let me still abide, Nor from my hope remove, Till Thou my patient spirit guide Into Thy perfect love. Amen.

Hymn.title: A CHRISTIAN HOME
Hymn.stanza: 1. O give us homes built firm upon the Saviour, Where Christ is Head, and Counsellor and Guide; Where ev'ry child is taught His love and favour And gives his heart to Christ, the crucified: How sweet to know that tho' his footsteps waver His faithful Lord is walking by his side!

4. O Lord, our God, our homes are Thine forever! We trust to Thee their problems, toil, and care; Their bonds of love no enemy can sever If Thou art always Lord and Master there: Be Thou the center of our least endeavour- Be Thou our Guest, our hearts and homes to share.

Hymn.title: JUST OBEY
Hymn.stanza: 1. Just as God who reigns on High Spake to men in days gone by, So the Lord is calling men today; And, my brother this is true, Whatsoe'er He says to you There is but one thing to do - Just obey
Hymn.chorus: Just obey. . ., just obey. . ., Is the way. . ., God's way. . ., When His message comes to you, There is but one thing to do, Just obey . . ., just obey.
Hymn.stanza: 2. If you're in the Saviour's hands, You must do as He commands, For there is no other gospel way; Never put the message by, Never stop to reason why, When the Saviour speaks to you - Just obey
Hymn.chorus: Just obey. . ., just obey. . ., Is the way. . ., God's way. . ., When His message comes to you, There is but one thing to do, Just obey . . ., just obey.
Hymn.stanza: 3. If for mansions fair you sigh In that land beyond the sky After time with you has pass'd away; Tho' the way you may not see, Christ is calling "Follow Me" Faith and duty both will cry - Just obey
Hymn.chorus: Just obey. . ., just obey. . ., Is the way. . ., God's way. . ., When His message comes to you, There is but one thing to do, Just obey . . ., just obey.

Hymn.title: 'TIS SO SWEET TO TRUST IN JESUS
Hymn.stanza: 'TIS SO SWEET TO TRUST IN JESUS 1. 'Tis so sweet to trust in Jesus, Just to take Him at His Word; Just to rest upon His promise, Just to know, "Thus says the Lord"
Hymn.chorus: Jesus, Jesus, how I trust Him! How I've proved Him o'er and o'er Jesus, Jesus, precious Jesus! O for grace to trust Him more!
Hymn.stanza: 2. O how sweet to trust in Jesus, Just to trust His cleansing blood; Just in simple faith to plunge me 'Neath the healing, cleansing flood!
Hymn.chorus: Jesus, Jesus, how I trust Him! How I've proved Him o'er and o'er Jesus, Jesus, precious Jesus! O for grace to trust Him more!
Hymn.stanza: 3. Yes, 'tis sweet to trust in Jesus, Just from sin and self to cease; Just from Jesus simply taking Life and rest, and joy and peace.
Hymn.chorus: Jesus, Jesus, how I trust Him! How I've proved Him o'er and o'er Jesus, Jesus, precious Jesus! O for grace to trust Him more!
Hymn.stanza: 4. I'm so glad I learned to trust Thee, Precious Jesus, Saviour, Friend; And I know that Thou art with me, Wilt be with me to the end.
Hymn.chorus: Jesus, Jesus, how I trust Him! How I've proved Him o'er and o'er Jesus, Jesus, precious Jesus! O for grace to trust Him more!

Hymn.title: LET OTHERS SEE JESUS IN YOU
Hymn.stanza: 1. While passing thro' this world of sin, and others your life shall view, Be clean and pure without, within; Let others see Jesus in you.
Hymn.chorus: Let others see Jesus in you,..... Let others see Jesus in you,..... Keep telling the story, be faithful and true; Let others see Jesus in you.
Hymn.stanza: 2. Your life's a book before their eyes, They're reading it thro' and thro' Say, does it point them to the skies, Do others see Jesus in you?
Hymn.chorus: Let others see Jesus in you,..... Let others see Jesus in you,..... Keep telling the story, be faithful and true; Let others see Jesus in you.
Hymn.stanza: 3. What joy 'twill be at set of sun, In mansions beyond the blue, To find some souls that you have won; Let others see Jesus in you.
Hymn.chorus: Let others see Jesus in you,..... Let others see Jesus in you,..... Keep telling the story, be faithful and true; Let others see Jesus in you.
Hymn.stanza: 4. Then live for Christ both day and night, Be faithful, be brave and true, and lead the lost to life and Light. Let others see Jesus in you.
Hymn.chorus: Let others see Jesus in you,..... Let others see Jesus in you,..... Keep telling the story, be faithful and true; Let others see Jesus in you.

Hymn.title: COUNT YOUR BLESSING
Hymn.stanza: 1. When upon life's billows you are tempest tossed, When you are discouraged, thinking all is lost, Count your many blessings, name them one by one, And it will surprise you what the Lord hath done.
Hymn.chorus: Count your blessings, name them one by one, Count your blessings, see what God hath done! Count your blessings, name them one by one, And it will surprise you what the Lord hath done.
Hymn.stanza: 2. Are you ever burdened with a load of care? Does the cross seem heavy you are called to bear? Count your many blessings, ev'ry doubt will fly, And you will keep singing as the days go by.
Hymn.chorus: Count your blessings, name them one by one, Count your blessings, see what God hath done! Count your blessings, name them one by one, And it will surprise you what the Lord hath done.
Hymn.stanza: 3. When you look at others with their lands and gold, Think that Christ has promised you His wealth untold; Count your many blessings money cannot buy Your reward in heaven, nor your home on high.
Hymn.chorus: Count your blessings, name them one by one, Count your blessings, see what God hath done! Count your blessings, name them one by one, And it will surprise you what the Lord hath done.
Hymn.stanza: 4. So amid the conflict whether great or small, Do not be discouraged, God is over all; Count your many blessings, angels will attend, Help and comfort give you to your journey's end.
Hymn.chorus: Count your blessings, name them one by one, Count your blessings, see what God hath done! Count your blessings, name them one by one, And it will surprise you what the Lord hath done.

Hymn.title: THAT BLESSED CANAAN LAND
Hymn.stanza: 1. There's a blessed land that we call Canaan, Land of promise, land of victory, Where the Spirit's given without measure, where the soul from self has been set free.
Hymn.chorus: It is wonderful to live in Canaan, Where the milk and honey flow, Where the land is bearing in abundance And the grapes of Eschol grow. It is wonderful to live in Canaan, Just a lovely place to dwell. won't you join that band where the life is grand, In that blessed Canaan land?
Hymn.stanza: 2. In the land of Canaan there is blessing, All his fullness as he takes control, Blessed fullness of the Holy Spirit; O what glory he brings to the soul!
Hymn.chorus: It is wonderful to live in Canaan, Where the milk and honey flow, Where the land is bearing in abundance And the grapes of Eschol grow. It is wonderful to live in Canaan, Just a lovely place to dwell. won't you join that band where the life is grand, In that blessed Canaan land?
Hymn.stanza: 3. Have you crossed the Jordan into Canaan, Have you left the wilderness behind And received the Spirit in His full-ness? If you haven't then make up your mind.
Hymn.chorus: It is wonderful to live in Canaan, Where the milk and honey flow, Where the land is bearing in abundance And the grapes of Eschol grow. It is wonderful to live in Canaan, Just a lovely place to dwell. won't you join that band where the life is grand, In that blessed Canaan land?

Hymn.title: COUNT ME
Hymn.stanza: 1. When you count the ones who love the Lord, Count me, count me; When you count up those who trust His Word, Count me, count me.
2. When you count up those who're saved by grace, Count me, count me; Who have found in Christ a hiding place, Count me, count me.
3. When you count up those who do the right, Count me, count me; Who are walking in the Gospel light, Count me, count me.
4.When you count up those who forward press, Count me, count me; Who shall gain the crown of righteousness, Count me, count me.

Hymn.title: SO SEND I YOU
Hymn.stanza: 1. So send I you - to labour unrewarded To serve unpaid, unloved, unsought, unknown To bear rebuke, to suffer scorn and scoffing So send I you - to toil for Me alone
Hymn.chorus: "As the Father hath sent Me, so send I you."
Hymn.stanza: 2. So send I you - to bind the bruised and broken O'er wandering souls to work, to weep, to wake To bear the burdens of a world a-weary So send I you - to suffer for My sake
Hymn.chorus: "As the Father hath sent Me, so send I you."
Hymn.stanza: 3. So send I you - to loneliness and longing With heart a-hungering for the loved and known Forsaking home and kindred, friend and dear one So send I you - to know My love alone
Hymn.chorus: "As the Father hath sent Me, so send I you."
Hymn.stanza: 4. So send I you - to leave your life's ambition To die to dear desire, self-will resign To labour long and love where men revile you So send I you - to lose your life in Mine
Hymn.chorus: "As the Father hath sent Me, so send I you."
Hymn.stanza: 5. So send I you - to hearts made hard by hatred To eyes made blind because they will not see To spend, tho' it be blood to spend and spare not So send I you - to taste of Calvary
Hymn.chorus: "As the Father hath sent Me, so send I you."

Hymn.title: I AM READY FOR SERVICE
Hymn.stanza: 1. Listen to the Master's pleading, There is urgent work for all; Heed the Spirit's interceding, Give this answer to the call:
Hymn.chorus: I am ready for service for Thee, dear Lord, Here am I, send me, I am willing to be what you'd have me be, I will go where you want me to go I am ready for service for Thee, dear Lord, Here am I, send me, Though the pathway seems dark For Thee I'll do or die, I am ready for service Lord.
Hymn.stanza: 2. There's a voice to you now calling, Will you heed the earnest word? On the ear it's gently calling, Give this answer to your Lord:
Hymn.chorus: I am ready for service for Thee, dear Lord, Here am I, send me, I am willing to be what you'd have me be, I will go where you want me to go I am ready for service for Thee, dear Lord, Here am I, send me, Though the pathway seems dark For Thee I'll do or die, I am ready for service Lord.
Hymn.stanza: 3. Many souls in sin are dying; Haste to help them while you may, For the time is swiftly flying, Will you now to Jesus say:
Hymn.chorus: I am ready for service for Thee, dear Lord, Here am I, send me, I am willing to be what you'd have me be, I will go where you want me to go I am ready for service for Thee, dear Lord, Here am I, send me, Though the pathway seems dark For Thee I'll do or die, I am ready for service, Lord.

Hymn.title: ANYWHERE WITH JESUS
Hymn.chorus: Anywhere, anywhere! Fear I cannot know; Anywhere with Jesus I can safely go.
Anywhere, anywhere! Fear I cannot know; Anywhere with Jesus I can safely go.
Hymn.stanza: 3. Anywhere with Jesus, over land and sea, Telling souls in darkness of salvation free; Ready as He summons me to go or stay, Anywhere with Jesus when He points the way.
Hymn.chorus: Anywhere, anywhere! Fear I cannot know; Anywhere with Jesus I can safely go.
Hymn.stanza: 4. Anywhere with Jesus I can go to sleep, When the darkening shadows round about me creep, Knowing I shall waken, never more to roam; Anywhere with Jesus will be home, sweet home.
Hymn.chorus: Anywhere, anywhere! Fear I cannot know; Anywhere with Jesus I can safely go.

Hymn.title: I LOVE, I LOVE MY MASTER
Hymn.stanza: 1. I love, I love my Master, I will not go out free! For He is my Redeemer; He paid the price for me. I would not leave His service, It is so sweet and blest; And in the weariest moments He gives the truest rest.

2. My Master shed His life-blood My vassal life to win, And save me from the bondage Of tyrant self and sin. He chose me for His service, And gave me power to choose That blessed, perfect freedom, Which I shall never lose.

3. I would not halve my service, His only it must be! His only, Who so loved me, And gave Himself for me. Rejoicing and adoring, Henceforth my song shall be - "I love, I love my Master, I will not go out free!"

Hymn.title: THEY THAT WAIT UPON THE LORD
Hymn.stanza: 1. Ho, reapers in the whitened harvest Oft feeble, faint, and few; Come, wait upon the blessed Master, Our strength He will renew.
2. Too oft a-weary and discouraged, We pour a sad complaint; Believing in a living Saviour, Why should we ever faint?
3. Rejoice! for He is with us alway, Lo, even to the end! Look up! take courage and go forward - All needed grace He'll send!

Hymn.title: THE LAST MILE OF THE WAY
Hymn.stanza: 1. If I walk in the pathway of duty, If I work till the close of the day, I shall see the great King in His beauty, When I've gone the last mile of the way.
Hymn.chorus: When I've gone the last mile of the way,... I will rest at the close of the day,... And I know there are joys that await me, When I've gone the last mile of the way.
Hymn.stanza: 2. If for Christ I proclaim the glad story, If I seek for His sheep gone astray, I am sure He will show me His glory, When I've gone the last mile of the way.
Hymn.chorus: When I've gone the last mile of the way,... I will rest at the close of the day,... And I know there are joys that await me, When I've gone the last mile of the way.
Hymn.stanza: 3. Here the dearest of ties we must sever, Tears of sorrow are seen ev'ry day; But no sickness, no sighing forever, When I've gone the last mile of the way.
Hymn.chorus: When I've gone the last mile of the way,... I will rest at the close of the day,... And I know there are joys that await me, When I've gone the last mile of the way.
Hymn.stanza: 4. And if here I have earnestly striven, And have tried all His will to obey, 'Twill enhance all the rapture of heaven, When I've gone the last mile of the way.
Hymn.chorus: When I've gone the last mile of the way,... I will rest at the close of the day,... And I know there are joys that await me, When I've gone the last mile of the way.

Hymn.title: LITTLE IS MUCH WHEN GOD IS IN IT
Hymn.stanza: 1. In the harvest field now ripened There's a work for all to do; Hark! the voice of God is calling, To the harvest calling you.
Hymn.chorus: Little is much when God is in it! Labour not for wealth or fame. There's a crown and you can win it, If you go in Jesus' Name.
Hymn.stanza: 2. Does the place you're called to labour Seem too small and little known? It is great if God is in it, And He'll not forget His own.
Hymn.chorus: Little is much when God is in it! Labour not for wealth or fame. There's a crown and you can win it, If you go in Jesus' Name.
Hymn.stanza: 3. Are you laid aside from service, Body worn from toil and care? You can still be in the battle, In the sacred place of pray'r.
Hymn.chorus: Little is much when God is in it! Labour not for wealth or fame. There's a crown and you can win it, If you go in Jesus' Name.
Hymn.stanza: 4. When the conflict here is ended And our race on earth is run, He will say, if we are faithful, "Welcome home, my child, well done"
Hymn.chorus: Little is much when God is in it! Labour not for wealth or fame. There's a crown and you can win it, If you go in Jesus' Name.

Hymn.title: WHERE COULD I GO?
Hymn.stanza: 1. Living below, in this old sinful world Hardly a comfort can afford; Striving alone to face temptations sore, Where could I go but to the Lord?
Hymn.chorus: Where could I go, O where could I go, Seeking a refuge for my soul? Needing a friend to help me in the end, Where could I go but to the Lord?
Hymn.stanza: 2. Neighbours are kind, I love them everyone We get along in sweet accord; But when my soul needs manna from above, Where could I go but to the Lord?
Hymn.chorus: Where could I go, O where could I go, Seeking a refuge for my soul? Needing a friend to help me in the end, Where could I go but to the Lord?
Hymn.stanza: 3. Life here is grand with friends I love so dear, Comfort I get from God's own word; Yet when I face this chilling hand of death, Where could I go but to the Lord?
Hymn.chorus: Where could I go, oh where could I go? Seeking a refuge for my soul? Needing a friend to help me in the end Where could I go but to the Lord?

Hymn.title: LORD, SPEAK TO ME, THAT I MAY SPEAK
Hymn.stanza: 1. Lord, speak to me that I may speak In living echoes of Thy tone; As Thou hast sought, so let me seek Thy erring children lost and lone.
2. Oh, lead me, Lord, that I may lead The wandering and the wavering feet; O feed me, Lord, that I may feed Thy hungering ones with manna sweet.
3. Oh, strengthen me, that while I stand Firm on the Rock; and strong in Thee, I may stretch out a loving hand To wrestlers with the troubled sea.
4. Oh teach me, Lord, that I may teach The precious things Thou dost impart; And wing my words, that they may reach The hidden depths of many a heart.
5. Oh, give Thine own sweet rest to me, That I may speak with soothing power A word in season, as from Thee, To weary ones in needful hour.
6. Oh, fill me with Thy fullness, Lord, Until my very heart o'erflow In kindling thought and glowing word, Thy love to tell, Thy praise to show.
7. Oh, use me, Lord, use even me, Just as Thou wilt, and how, and where; Until Thy blessed face I see, Thy rest, Thy joy, Thy glory share.

Hymn.title: GO, LABOUR ON
Hymn.stanza: 1. Go, labour on, spend, and be spent, Thy joy to do the Father's will: It is the way the Master went; Should not the servant tread it still?
3. Men die in darkness at thy side, Without a hope to cheer the tomb; Take up the torch and wave it wide, The torch that lights time's thickest gloom.
4. Toil on, and in thy toil rejoice, For toil comes rest, for exile home; Soon shalt thou hear the Bridegroom's voice, The midnight peal, "Behold, I come!"

Hymn.title: WILL THERE BE ANY STARS?
Hymn.stanza: 1. I am thinking today of that beautiful land I shall reach when the sun goeth down; When thro' wonderful grace by my Saviour I stand, Will there be any stars in my crown?
Hymn.chorus: Will there be any stars, any stars in my crown, When at evening the sun goeth down? When I wake with the blest in the mansions of rest, Will there be any stars in my crown?
Hymn.stanza: 2. In the strength of the Lord let me labour and pray, Let me watch as a winner of souls, That bright stars may be mine in the glorious day, When His praise like the sea billow roll.
Hymn.chorus: Will there be any stars, any stars in my crown, When at evening the sun goeth down? When I wake with the blest in the mansions of rest, Will there be any stars in my crown?
Hymn.stanza: 3. O what joy it will be when His face I behold, Living gems at his feet to lay down; It would sweeten my bliss in the city of gold, Should there be any stars in my crown?
Hymn.chorus: Will there be any stars, any stars in my crown, When at evening the sun goeth down? When I wake with the blest in the mansions of rest, Will there be any stars in my crown?

Hymn.title: THE OLD RUGGED CROSS
Hymn.stanza: 1. On a hill far away stood an old rugged cross, The emblem of suff'ring and shame; And I love that old cross where the dearest and best For a world of lost sinners was slain.
Hymn.chorus: So I'll cherish the old rugged cross,... Till my trophies at last I lay down; I will cling to the old rugged cross,... And exchange it some day for a crown.
Hymn.stanza: 2. Oh, that old rugged cross, so despised by the world, Has a wondrous attraction for me; For the dear Lamb of God left His glory above, To bear it to dark Calvary.
Hymn.chorus: So I'll cherish the old rugged cross,... Till my trophies at last I lay down; I will cling to the old rugged cross,... And exchange it some day for a crown.
Hymn.stanza: 3. In that old rugged cross, stained with blood so divine, A wondrous beauty I see, For 'twas on that old cross Jesus suffered and died, To pardon and sanctify me.
Hymn.chorus: So I'll cherish the old rugged cross,... Till my trophies at last I lay down; I will cling to the old rugged cross,... And exchange it some day for a crown.
So I'll cherish the old rugged cross,... Till my trophies at last I lay down; I will cling to the old rugged cross,... And exchange it some day for a crown.

Hymn.title: O HOW I LOVE JESUS
Hymn.stanza: 1. There is a Name I love to hear, I love to sing its worth; It sounds like music in my ear, The sweetest Name on earth.
Hymn.chorus: Oh, how I love Jesus, Oh, how I love Jesus, Oh, how I love Jesus, Because He first loved me!
Hymn.stanza: 2. It tells me of a Saviour's love, Who died to set me free; It tells me of His precious blood, The sinner's perfect plea.
Hymn.chorus: Oh, how I love Jesus, Oh, how I love Jesus, Oh, how I love Jesus, Because He first loved me!
Hymn.stanza: 3. It tells me what my Father hath In store for ev'ry day, And tho I tread a dark-some path, Yields sunshine all the way.
Hymn.chorus: Oh, how I love Jesus, Oh, how I love Jesus, Oh, how I love Jesus, Because He first loved me!
Hymn.stanza: 4. It tells of One whose loving heart Can feel my deepest woe; Who in each sorrow bears a part That none can bear below.
Hymn.chorus: Oh, how I love Jesus, Oh, how I love Jesus, Oh, how I love Jesus, Because He first loved me!

Hymn.title: JESUS IS THE SWEETEST NAME I KNOW
Hymn.stanza: 1. There have been names that I have loved to hear, But never has there been a name so dear To this heart of mine, as the name divine, The precious, precious name of Jesus.
Hymn.chorus: Jesus is the sweetest name I know, And He's just the same as His lovely name, And that's the reason why I love Him so; Oh, Jesus is the sweetest name I know.
Hymn.stanza: 2. There is no name in earth or Heav'n above, That we should give such honour and such love As the blessed name, let us all acclaim, That wondrous, glorious name of Jesus.
Hymn.chorus: Jesus is the sweetest name I know, And He's just the same as His lovely name, And that's the reason why I love Him so; Oh, Jesus is the sweetest name I know.
Hymn.stanza: 3. And someday I shall see Him face to face To thank and praise Him for His wondrous grace, Which He gave to me, when He made me free, The blessed Son of God named Jesus.
Hymn.chorus: Jesus is the sweetest name I know, And He's just the same as His lovely name, And that's the reason why I love Him so; Oh, Jesus is the sweetest name I know.

Hymn.title: MY JESUS I LOVE THEE
Hymn.stanza: 2. I love Thee because Thou hast first loved me, And purchased my pardon on Calvary's tree. I love Thee for wearing the thorns on Thy brow; If ever I loved Thee, my Jesus, 'tis now!
3. I'll love Thee in life, I will love Thee in death, And praise Thee as long as Thou lendest me breath, And say when the death-dew lies cold on my brow; If ever I loved Thee, my Jesus, 'tis now!

Hymn.title: SAVIOUR, LIKE A SHEPHERD LEAD US
Hymn.stanza: 1. Saviour, like a shepherd lead us, Much we need Thy tender care; In Thy pleasant pastures feed us, For our use Thy folds prepare. Blessed Jesus, blessed Jesus! Thou hast bought us, Thine we are. Blessed Jesus, blessed Jesus! Thou hast bought us, Thine we are.

2. We are Thine, do thou befriend us, Be the guardian of our way; Keep Thy flock, from sin defend us, Seek us when we go astray. Blessed Jesus, blessed Jesus! Hear, O hear us when we pray. Blessed Jesus, blessed Jesus! Hear, O hear us when we pray.

3. Thou hast promised to receive us, Poor and sinful tho' we be; Thou hast mercy to relieve us, Grace to cleanse and pow'r to free. Blessed Jesus, blessed Jesus! Early let us turn to Thee. Blessed Jesus, blessed Jesus! Early let us turn to Thee.

4. Early let us seek Thy favour, Early let us do Thy will; Blessed Lord and only Saviour, With Thy love our bossoms fill. Blessed Jesus, blessed Jesus! Thou hast loved us, love us still. Blessed Jesus, Blessed Jesus! Thou hast loved us, love us still.

5. Like a shepherd come receive us, When Thou comest in the air, In Thine arms wilt Thou now take us To that joyful union there: Blessed Jesus, Blessed Jesus, In that land beyond compare; Blessed Jesus, Blessed Jesus, In that land beyond compare.

Hymn.title: CHRIST BE BESIDE ME
Hymn.stanza: 1. Christ be beside me, Christ be before me, Christ be behind me - King of my heart; Christ be within me, Christ be below me, Christ be above me - never to part.
2. Christ on my right hand, Christ on my left hand, Christ all around me - Shield in strife; Christ in my sleeping, Christ in my sitting, Christ in my rising - Light of my life.
3. Christ be in all hearts thinking about me, Christ be in all tongues telling of me; Christ be the vision in eyes that see me, In ears that hear me Christ ever be.

Hymn.title: HAVE YOU ANY ROOM FOR JESUS?
Hymn.stanza: 1. Have you any room for Jesus, He who bore your load of sin? As He knocks and asks admission, Sinners, will you let Him in?
Hymn.chorus: Room for Jesus, King of Glory, Hasten now, His Word obey; Swing the heart's door widely open, Bid Him enter while you may.
Hymn.stanza: 2. Room for pleasure, room for business, But for Christ the Crucified; Not a place that He can enter, In your heart for which He died?
Hymn.chorus: Room for Jesus, King of Glory! Hasten now, His Word obey; Swing the heart's door widely open, Bid Him enter while you may.
Hymn.stanza: 3. Have you any room for Jesus, As in grace He calls again? O today is time accepted, Tomorrow you may call in vain.
Hymn.chorus: Room for Jesus, King of Glory! Hasten now, His Word obey; Swing the heart's door widely open, Bid Him enter while you may.
Hymn.stanza: 4. Room and time now give to Jesus, Soon will pass God's day of grace; Soon thy heart left cold and silent, And thy Saviour's pleading cease.
Hymn.chorus: Room for Jesus, King of Glory! Hasten now, His Word obey; Swing the heart's door widely open, Bid Him enter while you may.

Hymn.title: I WANT TO SEE JESUS, DON'T YOU?
Hymn.chorus: I want to see Jesus, don't you? My Saviour so faithful and true;... When I reach the strand of that love-bright land, O I want to see Jesus, don't you?...
Hymn.stanza: 2. When I'm weary and faint He is always near, With his joy He my strength doth renew; And He comforts my heart, speaking words of cheer: I want to see Jesus, don't you?
Hymn.chorus: I want to see Jesus, don't you? My Saviour so faithful and true;... When I reach the strand of that love-bright land, O I want to see Jesus, don't you?...
I want to see Jesus, don't you? My Saviour so faithful and true;... When I reach the strand of that love-bright land, O I want to see Jesus, don't you?...
Hymn.stanza: 4. He is fairer than lily or rose to me, And His blessings fall soft as the dew; O my heart, how it longs His dear face to see: I want to see Jesus, don't you?
Hymn.chorus: I want to see Jesus, don't you? My Saviour so faithful and true;... When I reach the strand of that love-bright land, O I want to see Jesus, don't you?...
Hymn.stanza: 5. There's a place for my soul that He doth prepare, And its beauty by faith I can view; First of all, when I enter that mansion fair, I want to see Jesus, don't you?
Hymn.chorus: I want to see Jesus, don't you? My Saviour so faithful and true;... When I reach the strand of that love-bright land, O I want to see Jesus, don't you?...

Hymn.title: THE SOLID ROCK
Hymn.stanza: 1. My hope is built on nothing less Than Jesus' blood and righteousness; I dare not trust the sweetest frame, But wholly lean on Jesus' name.
2. When darkness seems to hide His face, I rest on His unchanging grace; In every high and stormy gale, My anchor holds within the vale.
3. His oath, His covenant, His blood Support me in the whelming flood; When all around my soul gives way, He then is all my hope and stay.
4. When He shall come with trumpet sound, Oh, may I then in Him be found; Dressed in His righteousness alone, Faultless to stand before the throne.

Hymn.title: JESUS ONLY IS OUR MESSAGE
Hymn.stanza: 1. Jesus only is our message, Jesus all our theme shall be; We will lift up Jesus ever, Jesus only will we see.
Hymn.chorus: Jesus only, Jesus ever, Jesus all in all we sing; Saviour, Sanctifier, and Healer, Baptizer and coming King.
Hymn.stanza: 2. Jesus only is our Saviour, All our guilt He bore away, All our righteousness He gives us, All our strength from day to day.
Hymn.chorus: Jesus only, Jesus ever, Jesus all in all we sing; Saviour, Sanctifier, and Healer, Baptizer and coming King.
Hymn.stanza: 3. Jesus is our Sanctifier, Cleansing us from self and sin, And with all His Spirit's fulness, Filling all our hearts within.
Hymn.chorus: Jesus only, Jesus ever, Jesus all in all we sing; Saviour, Sanctifier, and Healer, Baptizer and coming King.
Hymn.stanza: 4. Jesus only is our Healer, All our sicknesses He bare, And His risen life and fullness, All His members still may share.
Hymn.chorus: Jesus only, Jesus ever, Jesus all in all we sing; Saviour, Sanctifier, and Healer, Baptizer and coming King.
Hymn.stanza: 5. Jesus only is our Power, He the Gift of Pentecost, Jesus, breathe Thy power upon us, Fill us with the Holy Ghost.
Hymn.chorus: Jesus only, Jesus ever, Jesus all in all we sing; Saviour, Sanctifier, and Healer, Baptizer and coming King.
Hymn.stanza: 6. And for Jesus we are waiting, Listening for the trumpet's sound; Then it will be us and Jesus, Living ever with our God.
Hymn.chorus: Jesus only, Jesus ever, Jesus all in all we sing; Saviour, Sanctifier, and Healer, Baptizer and coming King.

Hymn.title: THE HEART THAT WAS BROKEN FOR ME
Hymn.stanza: 1. There came from the skies in the days long ago The Lord with a message of love; The world knew Him not; He was treated with scorn This wonderful gift from above
Hymn.chorus: They crowned Him with thorns He was beaten with stripes He was smitten and nailed to the tree But the pain in His heart Was the hardest to bear The heart that was broken for me...
They crowned Him with thorns He was beaten with stripes He was smitten and nailed to the tree But the pain in His heart Was the hardest to bear The heart that was broken for me...
Hymn.stanza: 3. The birds have their nests, and the foxes have holes, But He had no place for His head; A pallet of stone on the cold mountain side Was all that He had for His bed.
Hymn.chorus: They crowned Him with thorns He was beaten with stripes He was smitten and nailed to the tree But the pain in His heart Was the hardest to bear The heart that was broken for me...
I'll take up my cross I will walk by His side For the pathway of duty I see I will follow my Lord And abide in His heart, The heart that was broken for me...

Hymn.title: THE CHURCH'S ONE FOUNDATION
Hymn.stanza: 1. The church's one foundation Is Jesus Christ her Lord; She is His new creation By water and the Word. From Heav'n he came and sought her To be his holy bride; With his own blood He bought her, And for her life He died.

2. Elect from every nation, Yet one o'er all the earth; Her charter of salvation, One Lord, one faith, one birth; One holy name she blesses, Partakes one holy food, And to one hope she presses, With every grace endued.
